name: Executive Suites Hotel & Resort

reviews.text: Excellent value- we had a 2 bedroom suite with 3 young kids. rooms were 5* quality and the web site picture does not do them justice......would recommend this hotel- the only thing that they should change is provide free internet rather than having to pay for it...
reviews.title: Great value - very modern hotel with fantastic views of the mountains!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suites are ok with fully equipped kitchen area, though bathroom much too small.
reviews.title: Overpriced average stay

reviews.text: Bedroom also quite small.
reviews.title: This place is awesome but a bit hard to find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hallways, elevators etc. are rather motel-like.
reviews.title: Beautiful mountain views

reviews.text: Free parking (surface or garage).
reviews.title: Really relaxing view!

reviews.text: Our group had meetings at this hotel and it was so wonderful! The rooms were beautiful - spacious and all the ammenities you would need. The view was spectacular and the food was wonderful. All the staff we encountered was very friendly. I would recommend this property to anyone.
reviews.title: Beautiful property with great staff

reviews.text: WHat can I say, excellent facilties. Rooms great, brilliant kitchen, bathroom etc. Cannot fault. Would use again without hesitation. Can't wait to go again
reviews.title: Excellent. Wish we had found it sooner!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you ever find yourself in Squamish or its surrounding areas, you need to stay at this hotel. We checked in and were instantly upgraded to a king suite. The rooms were absolutely stunning. The hotels highlights include cleanliness, friendly staff, beautiful surroundings and free parking.
reviews.title: Hidden gem in the middle of nowhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed here for one night but wished we had a little more time to relax in this location. We were unable to check out the on sight restaurant or the pool and jacuzzi. However all of these are offered. The hotel is about forty five minutes from Whistler and surrounded by breath taking mountains.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: You cannot beat this place for its price and quality. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped here to and from the way to Whistler. It allowed us to extend our time skiing without having to pay Whistler prices. We stayed in 2 different rooms - I'd recommend the upgraded suite.
reviews.title: Great place to stay to and from Whistler - very good value

reviews.text: The restaurant is good not great. There is underground parking which is a real plus in the winter. The rooms are well furnished suites.
reviews.title: Clean, spacious. Convenient. Comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue we had was there was a high school hockey team there during our 2nd night. They made a lot of noise. It took a few calls to the front desk to get them to resolve this.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Relaxing Stay

reviews.text: We found this THE DAY we needed a room. Rate was $130 for basically a 1BR condo w/ private bedroom for Mom and Dad. Kids slept on comfortable pull out sofa. Did laundry in en suite washer/dryer. FULL kitchen w/ full size appliances. Fireplace, granite counters. Great deal for the price. And clean. Nice view of mountains. Stay here.
reviews.title: Mostly excellent, but some quirks

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Executive Suites Garibaldi in early May.
reviews.title: Best Value for your Money in Squamish

reviews.text: We recently stayed two nights at the Executive Suites as part of a tourism conference. I hesitated to write a review because of the nature of our visit but a couple of things struck me as relevant to visitors. This property provides all the amenties that you would expect in a resort - full kitchen with appliances plus a washer/dryer and separate bedroom. If a visitor is looking to explore the Squamish area includng all the great hiking and water activity as well as close proximity to the amazing Brittania Mine Museum then this is a great choice. Only issue was the mobile reception. For some reason phone service is spotty. Perhaps not a bad thing though when you are on vacation! Just not great when working.
reviews.title: Nice alternative to Whistler

reviews.text: The hotel is in a very quiet location surrounded by beautiful mountains. The 1 bedroom suite was clean and spacious, the kitchen was fully equipped and I could use the internet for free. However, interactions with the hotel staff made my stay very terrible! I have never encountered such an impolite staff... I would recommend the Hotel for a one night stay, but if you plan to stay for more than one night DO NOT STAY THERE...
reviews.title: Very Rude and Impolite Staff

reviews.text: Generally it is a lovely place to stay. Reception staff could be a bit more welcoming, seemed a bit like McDonalds style at times. We had a room on the fourth floor, and were surprised to see, it was more like a flat, with all the mod cons. It had coffee machine, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, microwave, but was what missing was cutlery. Bed was comfy, fresh, matress of sturdy built, a wee balcony with a nice view to the golf course. the sleep quality was very good. The shower was a little tricky to operate at the beginning, but got the hang of it in the end. checkout was smooth and quick. We also took advantage of the room service, whoch was polite and efficient. We would have no hesitations in highly recommending this place to stay.
reviews.title: More than we expected! A great stay for one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing rooms with incredibly modern kitchens. Lots of room, extremely clean, very quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel (Great for Whistler visitors, only 30 mins away)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price was exceptional for the accommodations. The hotel bar/restaurant was also great and very well priced (very surprised).
reviews.title: New clean stylish beautiful rooms

description: Ideal For Leisure and Corporate Travelers, A Perfect Couple’s Retreat...Or The Ultimate Family Getaway!Executive Suites Hotel and Resort, Squamish is a spacious all-season and all-suite hotel located in Squamish, British Columbia along the scenic Sea to Sky Highway (just 40 minutes from Vancouver and Whistler Village). With A choice of 111 Suites featuring fully equipped kitchens and private balconies, stunning views and free Wireless High Speed Internet, Adventure Desk, Living Well In Room Spa and a Heated Outdoor Pool and Hot tub. Executive Suites Squamish Hotel & Resort has your comfort and enjoyment in mind.Set in the outdoor adventure capital of Canada, this Squamish Hotel & Resort is ideally situated to provide guests with the best in outdoor adventure including climbing, hiking, biking, kayaking, windsurfing, and so much more...
